trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. It can't gain HP or temporary hit points.

action.name: Staggering Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage if the swarm is bloodied, and the target makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target is {@condition staggered|LevelUp} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Slow to Rouse
entries: A rock dragon awakens slowly outside its mating period and suffers disadvantage on their Perception checks while not in combat. It also suffers disadvantage on initiative rolls, and during the first round of combat it can only make one claw or bite attack.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: When motionless, a rock dragon is indistinguishable from a rocky outcrop.

trait.name: Sand Shifter
entries: The ground within 10 feet of a conscious rock dragon becomes difficult terrain, which the rock dragon ignores.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rock dragon makes a bite and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the rock dragon can't bite a different creature, and it has advantage on bite attacks against the {@condition grappled} creature.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Crushing Roll
entries: The rock dragon begins to thrash, its spines churning up the earth and lashing out against nearby creatures. Each creature within 5 feet of the rock dragon makes a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 50 ({@damage 10d8 + 5}) slashing damage on a failure. Large or smaller creatures that fails the saving throw are also pushed 15 feet directly away from the rock dragon and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, creatures take half damage and are not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Poltergeist
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Ethereal Form
entries: The poltergeist lives on the Ethereal Plane. While on that plane, it can't be sensed or attacked by creatures on the Material Plane.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The poltergeist can see into both the Material Plane and Ethereal Plane.

trait.name: Phantasmal Dissolution
entries: When the poltergeist is destroyed, it appears in its true form for a moment and dissipates into glowing dust.

action.name: Possess Object
entries: While on the Ethereal Plane, the poltergeist magically possesses a Medium or smaller unattended non-magical object in a corresponding space on the Material Plane. Until this possession ends, the poltergeist invisibly enters the object and exists on the Material Plane. The poltergeist can use its movement to move the object and use its action to manipulate the object (such as by causing a possessed door to slam or lock, or a piano to play). While the object stays still, the possession can be detected by effects and spells like {@spell detect evil and good|LevelUp} and {@spell detect magic|LevelUp} or by a {@dc 13} Investigation or Religion check.

Any attacks or effects that would target or affect a possessed object instead target or affect the poltergeist. The possession ends after 1 minute, when the poltergeist is {@condition incapacitated}, when the poltergeist ends it as an action, or when the poltergeist is turned or affected by {@spell dispel evil and good|LevelUp} or a similar effect. When the possession ends, the object is destroyed and cannot be possessed again, and the poltergeist returns to the Ethereal Plane. If the poltergeist is reduced to 0 hit points while possessing an object, the poltergeist and the object are both destroyed.

action.name: Slam (While Possessing Object)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (depending on possessed object).

action.name: Throw (While Possessing Object)
entries: The poltergeist throws a possessed object up to 30 feet, ending the possession and destroying the object. If the object is thrown at a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage (depending on possessed object).

action.name: Horrid Illusion (3/Day)
entries: While on the Ethereal Plane, the poltergeist creates a magical illusion, changing the appearance of a Large or smaller object in a corresponding space on the Material Plane. The illusion lasts for 1 minute or until the poltergeist or the object leaves its space. The poltergeist can't change the basic shape of the object by more than a few inches and can't create a visual illusion in an empty space.

When the illusion appears, each creature of the poltergeist's choice within 30 feet of the illusion that can see it makes a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target gains a level of {@condition strife|LevelUp}. On a success, the creature recognises the illusion as false and is immune to Horrid Illusion for 24 hours.

monster.name: Phantasmal Poltergeist
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Ethereal Form
entries: The poltergeist lives on the Ethereal Plane. While on that plane, it can't be sensed or attacked by creatures on the Material Plane.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The poltergeist can see into both the Material Plane and Ethereal Plane.

trait.name: Phantasmal Dissolution
entries: When the poltergeist is destroyed, it appears in its true form for a moment and dissipates into glowing dust.

trait.name: Phantasmal Illusion
entries: When a creature fails its saving throw against the poltergeist's Horrid Illusion while the poltergeist is bloodied, the poltergeist regains 10 hit points.

action.name: Possess Object
entries: While on the Ethereal Plane, the poltergeist magically possesses a Medium or smaller unattended non-magical object in a corresponding space on the Material Plane. Until this possession ends, the poltergeist invisibly enters the object and exists on the Material Plane. The poltergeist can use its movement to move the object and use its action to manipulate the object (such as by causing a possessed door to slam or lock, or a piano to play). While the object stays still, the possession can be detected by effects and spells like {@spell detect evil and good|LevelUp} and {@spell detect magic|LevelUp} or by a {@dc 13} Investigation or Religion check.

Any attacks or effects that would target or affect a possessed object instead target or affect the poltergeist. The possession ends after 1 minute, when the poltergeist is {@condition incapacitated}, when the poltergeist ends it as an action, or when the poltergeist is turned or affected by {@spell dispel evil and good|LevelUp} or a similar effect. When the possession ends, the object is destroyed and cannot be possessed again, and the poltergeist returns to the Ethereal Plane. If the poltergeist is reduced to 0 hit points while possessing an object, the poltergeist and the object are both destroyed.

action.name: Slam (While Possessing Object)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (depending on possessed object).

action.name: Throw (While Possessing Object)
entries: The poltergeist throws a possessed object up to 30 feet, ending the possession and destroying the object. If the object is thrown at a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage (depending on possessed object).

action.name: Horrid Illusion (3/Day)
entries: While on the Ethereal Plane, the poltergeist creates a magical illusion, changing the appearance of a Large or smaller object in a corresponding space on the Material Plane. The illusion lasts for 1 minute or until the poltergeist or the object leaves its space. The poltergeist can't change the basic shape of the object by more than a few inches and can't create a visual illusion in an empty space.

When the illusion appears, each creature of the poltergeist's choice within 30 feet of the illusion that can see it makes a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target gains a level of {@condition strife|LevelUp}. On a success, the creature recognises the illusion as false and is immune to Horrid Illusion for 24 hours.

action.name: Elite Recovery (While Bloodied)
entries: The poltergeist ends one negative effect currently affecting it. It can use this action as long as it has at least 1 hit point, even while {@condition unconscious} or {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Telekinetic Cloud (While Bloodied and Possessing Object)
entries: The phantasmal poltergeist causes nearby Tiny objects, debris, and dust to coalesce into a swirling cloud around the poltergeist within a radius of 20 feet. A creature that enters this area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Ice Climb
entries: THe ant can climb icy surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Torpor
entries: Over the course of one hour the ant enters hibernation. While in this state it doesn't require food or drink and remains asleep until awoken by its queen, or its resting place is disturbed. When leaving torpor because it was disturbed, a rime ant is sleepy and suffers disadvantage on any Dexterity or attack rolls on the first round of combat.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3} slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the ankheg can't use its claws on anyone else.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the ankheg. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3} slashing damage. If this damage kills the target, the ankheg severs its head.

action.name: Icy Breath (Recharge 6)
entries: The ant releases a cloud of incredibly cold air in a 30 foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage on a failure or half damage on a success. In addition, on a failure the creature is coated in a layer of restrictive ice that halves its movement speed until it spends an action to clear it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ant's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, spell attack bonus +6). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Ice Climb
entries: THe ant can climb icy surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Torpor
entries: Over the course of up to one hour the ant enters hibernation. While in this state it doesn't require food or drink and remains asleep until the duration ends (chosen when entering torpor), or its resting place is disturbed. When leaving torpor because it was disturbed, a rime ant is sleepy and suffers disadvantage on any Dexterity or attack rolls on the first round of combat.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3} slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the ankheg can't use its claws on anyone else.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the ankheg. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3} slashing damage. If this damage kills the target, the ankheg severs its head.

action.name: Icy Breath (Recharge 6)
entries: The ant releases a cloud of incredibly cold air in a 30 foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage on a failure or half damage on a success. In addition, on a failure the creature is coated in a layer of restrictive ice that halves its movement speed until it spends an action to clear it.

action.name: Awakening
entries: The queen sends out a telepathic pulse that travels up to 300 feet through the ice. If there is a hibernating group of ants within range they awake from torpor and immediately begin moving towards her as fast as they can.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While motionless, the gargoyle is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gargoyle attacks with its bite and its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage if the gargoyle started its turn at least 20 feet above the target.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Empowered Blows (Once Ever, While Bloodied)
entries: The guardian permanently increases its Strength score by 4.

bonus.name: Empowered Movement (Once Ever, While Bloodied)
entries: The guardian permanently increases its movement speed by 20 feet. Additionally, until the end of its turn it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when flying.

reaction.name: Empowered Defences (Recharge 6+, While Bloodied)
entries: When it is hit by an attack, the guardian's eyes flare with power. Until the start of its next turn, it gains a +3 bonus to its AC, including against the triggering attack.

monster.name: Lost Prospector
languages: the languages it spoke in life

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see into both the Material and Ethereal Plane.

trait.name: Incorporeal
entries: The ghost can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: A ghost doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

trait.name: Unquiet Spirit
entries: If defeated in combat, the ghost returns in 24 hours. It can be put to rest permanently only by finding and casting {@spell remove curse|LevelUp} on its remains or by resolving the unfinished business that keeps it from journeying to the afterlife.

trait.name: Gold Sense
entries: The lost prospector has advantage on Perception checks made to notice any creature carrying at least 1 gp.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) necrotic damage. If the target is {@condition frightened}, it is magically aged {@dice 1d4} x 10 years. The aging effect can be reversed with a {@spell greater restoration|LevelUp} spell. Additionally, the lost prospector corrupts the same amount of gold pieces from the victim as the damage dealt by the attack, turning the coins to worthless metal. If the victim carries no gold pieces this has no effect. If the ghost can successfully be put to rest within 24 hours, the coins are restored.

action.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: The ghost magically shifts from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane or vice versa. If it wishes, it can be visible to creatures on one plane while on the other.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet and on the same plane of existence that can see the ghost makes a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the ghost's Horrifying Visage for 24 hours.

action.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries: One humanoid within 5 feet makes a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, it is possessed by the ghost. The possessed creature is {@condition unconscious}. The ghost enters the creature's body and takes control of it. The ghost can be targeted only by effects that turn undead, and it retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. It grants its host body immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed creature's statistics and actions instead of its own. It doesn't gain access to the creature's memories but does gain access to proficiencies, nonmagical class features and traits, and nonmagical actions. It can't use limited-use abilities or class traits that require spending a resource. The possession ends after 24 hours, when the body drops to 0 hit points, when the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or when the ghost is turned or affected by {@spell dispel evil and good|LevelUp} or a similar effect. Additionally, the possessed creature repeats its saving throw whenever it takes damage. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in a space within 5 feet of the body. A creature is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on its saving throw or after the possession ends.

action.name: Drain Heat
entries: The ghost magically drains the heat from a 15-foot-radius area around it. Each creature in the area makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage on a failure or half damage on a success. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage can't regain hit points until the start of the ghost's next turn.

action.name: Pyrokinesis
entries: The ghost magically ignites up to three flammable, unattended, nonmagical objects it can see within 30 feet. Each creature within 5 feet of an object when it ignites makes a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

action.name: Spew Ectoplasm
entries: The ghost vomits a spray of ectoplasm in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a success, the creature is {@condition rattled|LevelUp} until the end of its next turn. On a failure, the creature is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Telekinetic Shove
entries: The ghost targets one Large or smaller creature within 60 feet. THe target makes a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the ghost magically moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward. If the target strikes and object, such as a wall, it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage and falls {@condition prone}. If the target would strike another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: If the ghost takes damage from an attack or spell, it uses Horrifying Visage.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any route it has travelled.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The minotaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The minotaur gores once and attcks twice with its greataxe.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target makes a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw, being pushed up to 5 feet away and falling {@condition prone} on a failure. If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the attack deals an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) damage.

action.name: Intimidating Bellow (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The minotaur conqueror emits a threatening cry. Each creature in a 60-foot radius who can hear it must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature is {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} until the end of the minotaur conqueror's next turn or until the creature receives damage.

bonus.name: Roar of Triumph
entries: If the minotaur reduced a living creature to 0 hit points since the end of its last turn, it roars and gains 35 ({@dice 10d6}) temporary hit points.

bonus.name: Stomp the Opposition
entries: The minotaur conqueror strikes the ground, creating a shockwave in a 15-foot radius centered on itself. Creatures standing in the area must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Luz Mala
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Conductive
entries: Each time a creature touches the will-o'-wisp or hits it with a metal melee weapon for the first time on a turn, the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage. This trait doesn't function while the will-o'-wisp's glow is extinguished.

trait.name: Insubstantial
entries: The will-o'-wisp can't pick up or move objects or creatures. It can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Treasure Sense
entries: The will-o'-wisp knows the location of coins, gems, and other nonmagical wealth within 500 feet.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: A will-o'-wisp doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

trait.name: Dreadful Light
entries: A creature that begins its turn in the area illuminated by the luz mala or enters it for the first time on a turn must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the luz mala and drop whatever it's holding. These effects last for one minute, and the creature can repeat the saving throw at the beginning of its turn as long as the luz mala isn't in its line of sight, ending the effect on a success. This effect also ends if the luz mala extinguishes its light. If a creature's saving throw is successful, it is immune to any luz mala's Dreadful Light for 24 hours.

action.name: Shock
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage. The will-o'-wisp can't make this attack while its glow is extinguished.

action.name: Spirit Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage. The luz mala can't make this attack while its glow is extinguished.

bonus.name: Illumination
entries: The will-o'-wisp alters the radius of its glow (shedding bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for the same number of feet beyond that radius), changes the color of its glow, or extinguishes its glow (making it {@condition invisible}).

spell.name: Beautify Creature

entries.name: Target
entries: A creature of up to Large size

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Wisdom negates

The creature is immediately and beautifully groomed, as if it had been lovingly attended to by a group of no less than 4 highly-skilled servants. Its clothing (if it has any) will be spotlessly clean with any minor damage mended and, at the creature's option, it may also be festooned with ribbons, be perfumed, and have makeup, face paint, or body paint applied. If the creature desires, its hair, beard, fur, and/or feathers can be styled or cut by this spell. This spell can only provide the most basic of accessories, such as ribbons, simple hair pins, and the like, which disappear in 8 hours.

The creature gains an exerptise die on all non-combat related Persuasion and Performance checks for the next 8 hours. The DM may declare this effect ends early if the creature is in a grueling fight, caught in severe weather, or endures any other that may compromise the grooming.
A truly unwilling creature can resist the spell, but few do; the experience is very pleasant and tailored to the target's wishes and aesthetics, not the caster's.

spell.name: Chef's Palate

entries.name: Target
entries: A single serving of food or drink

You instantly learn the ingredients list and preparation method for the item of food or drink targeted by this spell. For one hour after you cast the spell you retain perfect, detailed knowledge sufficient to perfectly recreate the serving of food or drink, including an accurate awareness of any contaminants (including vermind and poisons, but not disease) in the fare. Identifying such contaminants as harmful usually requires a {@dc 10} Perception check, but the DM may use {@dc 15} for those that are uncommon, {@dc 20} for rare, or {@dc 25} for those that are truly unique. If preparing the food requires specialised expertise (such as intricate decorating skills or master-level knife work) you do not acquire these abilities, merely the knowledge that, if you had them, you could reproduce the food item. If you have a medium to write on, you can create an accurate recipe during the hour you retain knowledge of the food or drink.

spell.name: Convenient Retrieval

entries.name: Target
entries: An object carried in an unsecured container on your person.

You reach into the container and instantly retrieve an object, regardless of its position in the container. This allows you to quickly snatch an item from an extradimensional space such as a bag of holding, as well as retrieving items from more conventional containers, such as backpacks and sacks. For this spell to work, you must be holding or wearing the container, it must not be locked, tied shut, or otherwise secured, and it must contain the item you wish to retrieve. If any of these conditions are not met, the spell fails.

You may retrieve a specific object known to you, provided that you have observed it within 30 feet at least once. You may also choose to retrieve a certain type of object (for example, an instrument, ring, or weapon), at which point the DM randomly determines the specific item of that type you end up with. If the item can be wielded, such as a shield or weapon, the spell ends with you wielding it if you choose.

spell.name: Fertilise Field

components.m: a pinch of manure and the seeds, roots, or fruiting body of the desired crop

entries.name: Area
entries: 130-foot square area

You bless the ground to accommodate a specific crop. The soil alters its composition to become ideal for that specific plant, purging contaminants (such as salt or other undesirable minerals), instantly decomposing any bodies lying in its soil down to a depth of 5 feet, and dispelling curses of up to 4th level. For a year and a day, plants of the type specified at the casting of the spell produce 50% more yield than they normally would, potentially increasing the income of a farm if properly harvested. Bodies destroyed by this spell immediately become useless for {@spell speak with dead|LevelUp}, {@spell animate dead|LevelUp}, {@spell resurrection|LevelUp}, and other similar spells that require a body (the bodies of particularly powerful magical creatures may not be affected by this spell at the DM's discretion).

spell.name: Housekeeping

entries.name: Target
entries: A number of 5-foot squares within range

When you cast this spell, select a 10-foot square section within range. If it is a hard, treated or manufactured surface (such as wood, fabric, leather, stone, glass, or metal) it becomes spotlessly clean. Any foreign substances on the surface of the square that you specify such as dirt, blood, toxic chemicals, paint, ink, and so on vanish harmlessly, leaving the surface clean and sanitary. This cleaning makes it impossible to track a creature through the affected areas via mundane means, but the utter cleanliness may itself be suspicious. The spell has no effect on non-solid surfaces such as dirt, sand, or mud.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You may select an additional 5-foot square for each slot level above 1st. Each square must touch another square along at least one side and all squares must be within range.

spell.name: Instant Window

components.m: a small chisel and a piece of glass

entries.name: Target
entries: A solid surface (see below).

You create a window roughly 4 inches square, centered on the point that you touch. If the surface is more than 1 foot thick or made of materials other than wood, dirt, or stone, the spell fails. The window is sufficiently braced to prevent any structural weakening to the surrounding structure, but otherwise is just a small hole you can look through. The hole lasts for 1 minute, then vanishes. The hold can also be dismissed by the caster as a bonus action. Creatures in this space when the window vanishes are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take {@dice 1d6} force damage for every square moved.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level beyond 2nd, you can choose one of the following features:

items: Glass pane: the window comes with a pane of glass (AC 5, 2 hit points), which functions as a normal window pane, keeping rain, outside air, etc. out and inside air in.
Small-sized: the window is of sufficient diameter for a Small-sized creature to squeeze through as an action.
Medium-sized (counts as two features): the window is of sufficient diameter for a Medium creature to squeeze through as an action. Small creatures can pass through as part of their normal movement.
Barred: the window has heavy iron bars (AC 19, 50 hit points) covering it, granting three-quarters cover.
Increased duration: the window lasts for an additional minute. This feature can be chosen multiple times, increasing the duration by 1 minute each time.

spell.name: Laundry Day

components.m: a lump of soap and a needle

entries.name: Target
entries: A pile of laundry within range

When you cast this spell, choose a pile of laundry that you can see within range, weighing up to 25 pounds and occupying a single 5-foot square, to clean and repair. Threadbare or worn laundry is restored to as-new condition, and even extremely damaged laundry (bloodstained, cut to tatters in a combat, etc.) is restored. As long as at least half the material that comprises an article of laundry is present, it can be restored by this spell. This spell leaves no trace that the object was damaged.

This spell affects anything made of cloth, so even rugs, small sails, and tapestries may be restored. Magic items and constructs may be repaired in this way, but their magic is not restored. You gain an expertise die on maintenance checks if you are able to cast this spell on the item you are treating.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: FOr each spell slot level above 2nd, this spell can affect an additional 25 pounds of laundry occupying up to one additional 5-foot square.

spell.name: Map Marker

entries.name: Target
entries: A map

When casting this spell, touch a map. If you cast the spell in territory not depicted on the map, the spell fails. If you are in territory depicted on the map, your position is marked by a small glowing spot on the map. The spot continues to move with your position on it, updating once per minute. If you enter territory not marked on the map, the spell ends. While your position is marked this way, you cannot become lost by mundane means and gain a {@dice 1d6} expertise die on all checks against becoming lost by magical means. Additionally, any critical or substantial failures on the Scout journey activity become failures.

The spell depicts your position as accurately as the map will allow, but poorly-drawn maps may lengthen the duration of your travel or cause you to make checks to avoid hazards at disadvantage at the DM's discretion.
